data.price: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, “Why are angels not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?” They have been too proud of themselves, and have transgressed immensely.
data.arabic: ۞ وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرۡجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا لَوۡلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ أَوۡ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَاۗ لَقَدِ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ فِيٓ أَنفُسِهِمۡ وَعَتَوۡ عُتُوّٗا كَبِيرٗا

data.price: On the Day when they see the angels[8], there will be no glad tidings for the wicked, and [the angels] will say, “Absolutely forbidden for you[9].”
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ لَا بُشۡرَىٰ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجۡرٗا مَّحۡجُورٗا
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., upon death, after death, upon resurrection, etc. [9] Referring to all good things.

data.price: We will turn to whatever deeds they did and turn them into scattered dust[10].
data.arabic: وَقَدِمۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُواْ مِنۡ عَمَلٖ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ هَبَآءٗ مَّنثُورًا
data.footnotes: [10] Good deeds of the disbelievers will be of no avail to them on Judgment Day, such as charity, due to their disbelief and denial of the afterlife.

data.price: On that Day the people of Paradise will have the best abode and the finest resting place.
data.arabic: أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ يَوۡمَئِذٍ خَيۡرٞ مُّسۡتَقَرّٗا وَأَحۡسَنُ مَقِيلٗا

data.price: On the Day when the sky will split asunder with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in succession.
data.arabic: وَيَوۡمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِٱلۡغَمَٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا

data.price: The true dominion on that Day belongs to the Most Compassionate[11], and it will be a hard day for the disbelievers.
data.arabic: ٱلۡمُلۡكُ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡحَقُّ لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِۚ وَكَانَ يَوۡمًا عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ عَسِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [11] On Judgment Day the whole authority will be for Allah alone; whereas, in this world, Allah gave some authority to kings, rulers, etc.

data.price: On that Day, the wrongdoer will bite his hands saying, “Would that I had taken a way with the Messenger[12]!
data.arabic: وَيَوۡمَ يَعَضُّ ٱلظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيۡهِ يَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي ٱتَّخَذۡتُ مَعَ ٱلرَّسُولِ سَبِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., followed the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so[13] as a close friend!
data.arabic: يَٰوَيۡلَتَىٰ لَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أَتَّخِذۡ فُلَانًا خَلِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [13] i.e., the one who misguided him.

data.price: He led me astray from the Reminder[14] after it had come to me.” Satan always betrays man[15].
data.arabic: لَّقَدۡ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ ٱلذِّكۡرِ بَعۡدَ إِذۡ جَآءَنِيۗ وَكَانَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ خَذُولٗا
data.footnotes: [14] i.e., the Qur’an or Allah’s remembrance. [15] Forsakes him after leading him into evil.

data.price: The Messenger said, “O my Lord, my people have taken this Qur’an as a thing to be abandoned[16].”
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلرَّسُولُ يَٰرَبِّ إِنَّ قَوۡمِي ٱتَّخَذُواْ هَٰذَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ مَهۡجُورٗا
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., not reading it; not listening to it; not understanding it; not living by it; not conveying it to others; preferring something else to it, etc.

data.price: Thus did we assign for every prophet an enemy from among the wicked, but your Lord is sufficient as a Guide and Helper.
data.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلۡنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوّٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيٗا وَنَصِيرٗا

data.price: Those who disbelieve say, “Why was the Qur’an not sent down to him all at once?” [We sent it] in this way so that We may strengthen your heart thereby, and We have revealed it in a gradual manner.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَوۡلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ جُمۡلَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَۖ وَرَتَّلۡنَٰهُ تَرۡتِيلٗا

data.price: Whenever they bring you an argument, We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
data.arabic: وَلَا يَأۡتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَأَحۡسَنَ تَفۡسِيرًا

data.price: Those who will be dragged on their faces to Hell – they will be in the worst position and farthest astray from the right path.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُحۡشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ شَرّٞ مَّكَانٗا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلٗا

data.price: We gave Moses the Scripture and appointed along with him his brother Aaron as a helper.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا مُوسَى ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَجَعَلۡنَا مَعَهُۥٓ أَخَاهُ هَٰرُونَ وَزِيرٗا

data.price: We said, “Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs[17].” Then We destroyed them utterly.
data.arabic: فَقُلۡنَا ٱذۡهَبَآ إِلَى ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَدَمَّرۡنَٰهُمۡ تَدۡمِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [17] i.e., the divine teachings reached them through Prophet Jacob and Joseph, and the righteous people of Israel.

data.price: Also the people of Noah, when they rejected the messengers[18], We drowned them and made them an example for mankind. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُواْ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَغۡرَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ لِلنَّاسِ ءَايَةٗۖ وَأَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمٗا
data.footnotes: [18] Denial of Noah was equal to denying all of Allah’s messengers.

data.price: Also [We destroyed] ‘Ād and Thamūd, and the people of the Well[19], and many generations between them.
data.arabic: وَعَادٗا وَثَمُودَاْ وَأَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونَۢا بَيۡنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [19] i.e., people of prophet Shuʿayb, or those mentioned in Surah Yā Sīn (36:13-29), or a tribe of Thamūd, etc. Rass (lit., well); for they killed their prophet by throwing him into or hanging him down an old or dry well. (Well)

data.price: To each We gave examples [of the previous nations], and each We destroyed completely.
data.arabic: وَكُلّٗا ضَرَبۡنَا لَهُ ٱلۡأَمۡثَٰلَۖ وَكُلّٗا تَبَّرۡنَا تَتۡبِيرٗا

data.price: They have surely passed by the town[20] that was destroyed by a terrible rain [of stones]. Have they not seen it? But they do not expect to be resurrected[21].
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَتَوۡاْ عَلَى ٱلۡقَرۡيَةِ ٱلَّتِيٓ أُمۡطِرَتۡ مَطَرَ ٱلسَّوۡءِۚ أَفَلَمۡ يَكُونُواْ يَرَوۡنَهَاۚ بَلۡ كَانُواْ لَا يَرۡجُونَ نُشُورٗا
data.footnotes:
[20] i.e., the city of Sodom; the people of Prophet Lot.
 [21] So they do not take lessons from the doom of the past nations.

data.price: When they see you [O Prophet], they only ridicule you, “Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي بَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولًا

data.price: He would have almost led us astray from our gods if we had not been so devoted to them.” But when they see the punishment, they will come to know who is further astray from the right way.
data.arabic: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنۡ ءَالِهَتِنَا لَوۡلَآ أَن صَبَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهَاۚ وَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوۡنَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ مَنۡ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

data.price: Have you [O Prophet] seen the one who takes his desire as his god, will you then be a keeper over him?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيۡهِ وَكِيلًا

data.price: Do you think that most of them hear or understand?[22] They are just like cattle[23], rather they are further astray from the right way.
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ يَسۡمَعُونَ أَوۡ يَعۡقِلُونَۚ إِنۡ هُمۡ إِلَّا كَٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمِ بَلۡ هُمۡ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[22] They follow others blindly.
 [23] i.e., like livestock or sheep, that follow without asking wherever they are led.

data.price: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shade? If He had willed, He could have made it still. Then We made the sun an indication of it[24].
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيۡفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوۡ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنٗا ثُمَّ جَعَلۡنَا ٱلشَّمۡسَ عَلَيۡهِ دَلِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [24] i.e., indication for its existence or making it apparent.

data.price: Then We gradually draw it towards Us [i.e., Then the sun climbs up]?
data.arabic: ثُمَّ قَبَضۡنَٰهُ إِلَيۡنَا قَبۡضٗا يَسِيرٗا

data.price: It is He Who has made the night as a garment[25] for you, and made sleep for rest; and has made daytime for returning to life[26].
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيۡلَ لِبَاسٗا وَٱلنَّوۡمَ سُبَاتٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ نُشُورٗا
data.footnotes:
[25] It covers you in darkness and provides rest.
 [26] To return to your livelihood and activity.

data.price: It is He Who sends the winds as harbingers before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water,
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَرۡسَلَ ٱلرِّيَٰحَ بُشۡرَۢا بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡ رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ طَهُورٗا

data.price: so that We may revive therewith a dead land, and quench the thirst of countless beasts and humans We have created.
data.arabic: لِّنُحۡـِۧيَ بِهِۦ بَلۡدَةٗ مَّيۡتٗا وَنُسۡقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقۡنَآ أَنۡعَٰمٗا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرٗا

data.price: We distribute it among them so that they may take heed[27], but most people persist in their ingratitude.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ صَرَّفۡنَٰهُ بَيۡنَهُمۡ لِيَذَّكَّرُواْ فَأَبَىٰٓ أَكۡثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورٗا
data.footnotes: [27] Such as Allah’s ability to bring the dead to life.

data.price: If We had willed, We could have sent to each town a warner[28].
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ شِئۡنَا لَبَعَثۡنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرۡيَةٖ نَّذِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [28] But instead, Allah sent Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) as the final messenger for all people.

data.price: So do not obey the disbelievers, but strive against them with this [Qur’an] a great striving.
data.arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ وَجَٰهِدۡهُم بِهِۦ جِهَادٗا كَبِيرٗا

data.price: It is He Who merges the two bodies of water: one fresh and palatable and the other salty and bitter, and He has made between them a barrier and an insurmountable partition[29].
data.arabic: ۞ وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ هَٰذَا عَذۡبٞ فُرَاتٞ وَهَٰذَا مِلۡحٌ أُجَاجٞ وَجَعَلَ بَيۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخٗا وَحِجۡرٗا مَّحۡجُورٗا
data.footnotes: [29] When salt and fresh waters meet, although both mix together, each still keeps its distinctive qualities, as if a barrier prevents them from mixing completely.

data.price: It is He Who created human beings from water[30], then made between them bonds of kinship and marriage, for your Lord is Most Capable.
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَآءِ بَشَرٗا فَجَعَلَهُۥ نَسَبٗا وَصِهۡرٗاۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [30] i.e., the zygote (the mixture of sperm and egg).

data.price: Yet they worship besides Allah that which can neither benefit nor harm them; the disbeliever always collaborates against his Lord[31].
data.arabic: وَيَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمۡ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمۡۗ وَكَانَ ٱلۡكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ ظَهِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [31] i.e., helping and defending those who rebel against Allah.

data.price: We have not sent you [O Prophet] except as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرٗا وَنَذِيرٗا

data.price: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for it, except that anyone who wishes to take a path to his Lord[32].”
data.arabic: قُلۡ مَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [32] By spending in the way of Allah.

data.price: Put your trust in the Ever-Living Who never dies, and glorify Him with praise. He is Sufficient as All-Aware of the sins of His slaves –
data.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلۡ عَلَى ٱلۡحَيِّ ٱلَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِهِۦۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِۦ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًا

data.price: it is He Who created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in six Days[33], then rose over the Throne[34]. He is the Most Compassionate, so ask about Him the One Who is All-Aware.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ فَسۡـَٔلۡ بِهِۦ خَبِيرٗا
data.footnotes:
[33] The "six Days" does not necessarily mean six 24 hours of time; for a heavenly Day is 1,000 years of our time. (see 22:47), whereas the Day of Judgment will be 50,000 years of our time (see 70:4). Hence, its duration is only known to Allah.
 [34] See footnote 7:54.

data.price: When it is said to them, “Prostrate to the Most Compassionate,” they say, “What is ‘the Most Compassionate?’ Shall we prostrate to what you order us?” And it only increases their aversion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلرَّحۡمَٰنِ قَالُواْ وَمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ أَنَسۡجُدُ لِمَا تَأۡمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمۡ نُفُورٗا۩

data.price: Blessed is He Who placed in the sky constellations and placed therein a radiant lamp[35] and a luminous moon.
data.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجٗا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَٰجٗا وَقَمَرٗا مُّنِيرٗا
data.footnotes: [35] i.e., the sun.

data.price: It is He Who made the night and the day to follow each other so that everyone who wishes may reflect or become grateful.
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ خِلۡفَةٗ لِّمَنۡ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوۡ أَرَادَ شُكُورٗا

data.price: The slaves of the Most Compassionate are those who walk on earth humbly[36], and when the ignorant address them, they only say words of peace[37];
data.arabic: وَعِبَادُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَمۡشُونَ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ هَوۡنٗا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ ٱلۡجَٰهِلُونَ قَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗا
data.footnotes: [36] i.e., without arrogance, but with dignity. [37] i.e., words free from evil.

data.price: and those who spend the night prostrating and standing before their Lord;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمۡ سُجَّدٗا وَقِيَٰمٗا

data.price: and those who say, “Our Lord, turn the punishment of Hell away from us, for its punishment is unrelenting[38].”
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱصۡرِفۡ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
data.footnotes: [38] i.e., ever adhering.

data.price: It is an evil place to settle and an evil abode.”
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا سَآءَتۡ مُسۡتَقَرّٗا وَمُقَامٗا

data.price: And those who neither spend wastefully nor stingily, but are moderate between them;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَنفَقُواْ لَمۡ يُسۡرِفُواْ وَلَمۡ يَقۡتُرُواْ وَكَانَ بَيۡنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامٗا

data.price: and those who do not invoke besides Allah another god, and who do not kill a soul whom Allah has forbidden, except in the course of justice, and who do not commit adultery, for whoever does any of this will face the penalty,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَدۡعُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ وَلَا يَقۡتُلُونَ ٱلنَّفۡسَ ٱلَّتِي حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا يَزۡنُونَۚ وَمَن يَفۡعَلۡ ذَٰلِكَ يَلۡقَ أَثَامٗا

data.price: the punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, wherein he will remain disgraced forever,
data.arabic: يُضَٰعَفۡ لَهُ ٱلۡعَذَابُ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ وَيَخۡلُدۡ فِيهِۦ مُهَانًا

data.price: except those who repent and believe, and do righteous deeds; for them Allah will change their evil deeds into good deeds, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلٗا صَٰلِحٗا فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمۡ حَسَنَٰتٖۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورٗا رَّحِيمٗا

data.price: Whoever repents and does righteous deeds has turned to Allah with sincere repentance.
data.arabic: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحٗا فَإِنَّهُۥ يَتُوبُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَتَابٗا

data.price: And those who do not witness falsehood[39], and when they pass by futility, they pass by with dignity;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَشۡهَدُونَ ٱلزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِٱللَّغۡوِ مَرُّواْ كِرَامٗا
data.footnotes: [39] i.e., places of sin, evil, and indecency.

data.price: and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, they do not turn a deaf ear or a blind eye to them;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ لَمۡ يَخِرُّواْ عَلَيۡهَا صُمّٗا وَعُمۡيَانٗا

data.price: and those who say, “Our Lord, let our spouses and children be a source of joy for us[40], and make us good examples for the righteous.”
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبۡ لَنَا مِنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعۡيُنٖ وَٱجۡعَلۡنَا لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
data.footnotes: [40] i.e., a source of happiness for their righteousness and adhering to a straight path.

data.price: It is they who will be rewarded with high palaces [in Paradise] for their perseverance, and they will be received therein with salutations and greetings of peace,
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ يُجۡزَوۡنَ ٱلۡغُرۡفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُواْ وَيُلَقَّوۡنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةٗ وَسَلَٰمًا

data.price: abiding therein forever. What an excellent abode and a resting place!
data.arabic: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۚ حَسُنَتۡ مُسۡتَقَرّٗا وَمُقَامٗا

data.price: Say [O Prophet], “My Lord would not care at all about you, were it not for your supplication[41]. Now since you have rejected [the truth], the inevitable is bound to come[42].”
data.arabic: قُلۡ مَا يَعۡبَؤُاْ بِكُمۡ رَبِّي لَوۡلَا دُعَآؤُكُمۡۖ فَقَدۡ كَذَّبۡتُمۡ فَسَوۡفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامَۢا
data.footnotes:
[41] i.e., faith and worship.
 [42] Or it will be adhering to you.

data.price: Tā sīn mīm.[1]
data.arabic: طسٓمٓ
data.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

data.price: These are the verses of the clear Book.
data.arabic: تِلۡكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ

data.price: Perhaps you[2] will grieve yourself to death because they do not believe.
data.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [2] O Muhammad.

data.price: If We willed, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in humility[3].
data.arabic: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., they would be compelled to believe, being humbled.

data.price: No new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate except that they turn away from it.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: They have rejected [the Truth], soon there will come to them the consequences of their ridicule.
data.arabic: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ

data.price: Do they not see the earth, how many fine kinds of plants We grow in it?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them will not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: And [remember] when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people –
data.arabic: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: the people of Pharaoh; will they not fear [the punishment of] Allah?”
data.arabic: قَوۡمَ فِرۡعَوۡنَۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ

data.price: He said, “My Lord, I fear that they may reject me,
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ

data.price: and I will feel distressed and my tongue will not be fluent, so send Aaron along [to help me].
data.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ

data.price: Moreover, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me[4].”
data.arabic: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ
data.footnotes: [4] For killing a Coptic Egyptian by mistake before becoming a prophet.

data.price: Allah said, “Certainly not! Go, both of you, with Our signs[5]; We are with you, listening.
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., the miracles of the staff and the shining hand, given to Moses.

data.price: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messengers[6] from the Lord of the worlds,
data.arabic: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [6] The singular form in Arabic denotes that they both were sent with a single message.

data.price: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’”
data.arabic: أَنۡ أَرۡسِلۡ مَعَنَا بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed with us several years of your life?
data.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

data.price: Yet you did what you did[7], and you are extremely ungrateful.”
data.arabic: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., striking the Copt in support of a man from your people, who died as a result.

data.price: He said, “I did it when I had no guidance.
data.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: So I fled from you in fear. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.
data.arabic: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: Is this a favor that you remind me with, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?[8]
data.arabic: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., If you had not been cruel to the Israelites, I should not have been brought to your house for upbringing.

data.price: Pharaoh said, “What is ‘the Lord of the worlds’?”
data.arabic: قَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَا رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Moses said, “The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ

data.price: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear [what he just said]?”
data.arabic: قَالَ لِمَنۡ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ أَلَا تَسۡتَمِعُونَ

data.price: Moses said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّكُمۡ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “Your messenger who has been sent to you is truly insane!”
data.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: Moses said, “Lord of the east and west and all that is between them, if only you had sense!”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison.”
data.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ

data.price: Moses said, “What if I bring you a clear proof?”
data.arabic: قَالَ أَوَلَوۡ جِئۡتُكَ بِشَيۡءٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “Bring it then if you are truthful!”
data.arabic: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: So he threw down his staff, and suddenly it was a real serpent.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: And he drew out his hand, and it was glowing white to the beholders.
data.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ

data.price: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a learned magician!
data.arabic: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ

data.price: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic. What do you suggest?”
data.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ

data.price: They said, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch heralds to the cities
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ

data.price: to bring you every learned magician.”
data.arabic: يَأۡتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٖ

data.price: So the magicians were assembled at an appointed time on a known day[9].
data.arabic: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَٰتِ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., the morning of the festival day. See 20:58-59.

data.price: And it was said to the people, “Will you join the gathering,
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلۡ أَنتُم مُّجۡتَمِعُونَ

data.price: so that we may follow the magicians, if they are victorious?”
data.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a reward for us if we are victorious?”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: He said, “Yes, and then you will surely be of those who are close to me.”
data.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

data.price: Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you wish to throw.”
data.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ

data.price: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, “By the glory of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the victorious!”
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ

data.price: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it swallowed up all objects of their illusion.
data.arabic: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ

data.price: So the magicians fell down in prostration.
data.arabic: فَأُلۡقِيَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَٰجِدِينَ

data.price: They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”
data.arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

data.price: Pharaoh said, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your master who taught you magic, but you will soon come to know. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.”
data.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: They said, “No harm; we will surely return to our Lord.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ

data.price: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers.”
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: We inspired Moses, “Leave with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.”
data.arabic: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

data.price: So Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities[10],
data.arabic: فَأَرۡسَلَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [10] In order to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.

data.price: saying, “These are but a small band,
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَشِرۡذِمَةٞ قَلِيلُونَ

data.price: and they have enraged us,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَنَا لَغَآئِظُونَ

data.price: but we are all well-prepared.”
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَٰذِرُونَ

data.price: Thus did We drive them[11] out of their gardens and springs,
data.arabic: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَٰهُم مِّن جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٖ
data.footnotes: [11] i.e., Pharaoh and his people.

data.price: and their treasures and splendid dwellings.
data.arabic: وَكُنُوزٖ وَمَقَامٖ كَرِيمٖ

data.price: So it was, and We made the Children of Israel to inherit them.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَۖ وَأَوۡرَثۡنَٰهَا بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

data.price: They pursued them at sunrise.
data.arabic: فَأَتۡبَعُوهُم مُّشۡرِقِينَ

data.price: When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, “We are surely overtaken!”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ

data.price: Moses said, “Certainly not! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”
data.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

data.price: Then We inspired Moses, “Strike the sea with your staff,” so it parted, and each part became like a huge mountain.
data.arabic: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: Then We brought the others [i.e., the pursuers] close to that place,
data.arabic: وَأَزۡلَفۡنَا ثَمَّ ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: and We saved Moses and all those who were with him.
data.arabic: وَأَنجَيۡنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: Then we drowned the others.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغۡرَقۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: Relate to them the story of Abraham,
data.arabic: وَٱتۡلُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَبَأَ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

data.price: when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: They said, “We worship idols and remain devoted to them.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ

data.price: He said, “Do they hear you when you call upon them?
data.arabic: قَالَ هَلۡ يَسۡمَعُونَكُمۡ إِذۡ تَدۡعُونَ

data.price: Or can they benefit or harm you?”
data.arabic: أَوۡ يَنفَعُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَضُرُّونَ

data.price: They said, “No, but this is what we found our forefathers doing.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: He said, “Do you see what you have been worshiping,
data.arabic: قَالَ أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: you and your ancestors?
data.arabic: أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُمُ ٱلۡأَقۡدَمُونَ

data.price: Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of the worlds[12],
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [12] As they worshiped idols in addition to worshiping Allah.

data.price: Who created me, so He guides me;
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهۡدِينِ

data.price: and it is He Who provides me with food and drink;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِي هُوَ يُطۡعِمُنِي وَيَسۡقِينِ

data.price: and when I am ill He heals me;
data.arabic: وَإِذَا مَرِضۡتُ فَهُوَ يَشۡفِينِ

data.price: and He will cause me to die and then bring me back to life;
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحۡيِينِ

data.price: and I hope that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: “My Lord, grant me knowledge, and join me with the righteous,
data.arabic: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: and grant me an honorable mention among the later generations[13],
data.arabic: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] Muslims invoke Allah’s blessings upon Abraham (ﷺ) along with Muhammad (ﷺ) in their daily prayers.

data.price: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss;
data.arabic: وَٱجۡعَلۡنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: and forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray;
data.arabic: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: and do not disgrace me on the Day when all will be resurrected –
data.arabic: وَلَا تُخۡزِنِي يَوۡمَ يُبۡعَثُونَ

data.price: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ

data.price: except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart[14].”
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [14] A heart free from disbelief, polytheism, hypocrisy, arrogance, and show-off.

data.price: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
data.arabic: وَأُزۡلِفَتِ ٱلۡجَنَّةُ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ

data.price: and Hellfire will be uncovered to those who went astray,
data.arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِيمُ لِلۡغَاوِينَ

data.price: and they will be told, “Where are those whom you used to worship
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: other than Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”
data.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ

data.price: Then they will be hurled into Hell one upon another, along with those who led them astray,
data.arabic: فَكُبۡكِبُواْ فِيهَا هُمۡ وَٱلۡغَاوُۥنَ

data.price: and the followers of Iblīs, all together.
data.arabic: وَجُنُودُ إِبۡلِيسَ أَجۡمَعُونَ

data.price: There the deviants will say while quarreling with their false deities,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ وَهُمۡ فِيهَا يَخۡتَصِمُونَ

data.price: “By Allah, we were clearly misguided,
data.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: when we deemed you equal to the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: إِذۡ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: None led us astray except the wicked.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَضَلَّنَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: Now we neither have any intercessors,
data.arabic: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَٰفِعِينَ

data.price: nor a close friend.
data.arabic: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٖ

data.price: If only we had a chance to return, we would be among the believers.”
data.arabic: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is surely the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: The people of Noah rejected the messengers[15]
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٍ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
data.footnotes: [15] For denying Noah was equal to denying all of the messengers of Allah.

data.price: when their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
data.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.”
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: They said, “Shall we believe in you when you are followed by the lowest people[16]?”
data.arabic: ۞ قَالُوٓاْ أَنُؤۡمِنُ لَكَ وَٱتَّبَعَكَ ٱلۡأَرۡذَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] For they were mostly the poor and ordinary people, who enjoyed no position in society.

data.price: He said, “What knowledge do I have of what they do?
data.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: Their reckoning is only with my Lord if you realize!
data.arabic: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: I am not going to drive the believers away.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِطَارِدِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: I am only a clear warner.”
data.arabic: إِنۡ أَنَا۠ إِلَّا نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: They said, “O Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ

data.price: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوۡمِي كَذَّبُونِ

data.price: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers who are with me.”
data.arabic: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark.
data.arabic: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ

data.price: Then We drowned thereafter all the rest.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغۡرَقۡنَا بَعۡدُ ٱلۡبَاقِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: The people of ‘Ād rejected the messengers
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٌ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: when their brother Hūd said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
data.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Do you build a landmark[17] on every high place for no purpose?
data.arabic: أَتَبۡنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ ءَايَةٗ تَعۡبَثُونَ
data.footnotes: [17] They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by passersby, as a symbol of their wealth and power.

data.price: And do you construct for yourselves palaces, hoping that you will live forever?
data.arabic: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَخۡلُدُونَ

data.price: And when you attack [others], do you attack ruthlessly?
data.arabic: وَإِذَا بَطَشۡتُم بَطَشۡتُمۡ جَبَّارِينَ

data.price: So fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: And fear the One Who has provided you with everything you know:
data.arabic: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: Who provided you with livestock and children,
data.arabic: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنۡعَٰمٖ وَبَنِينَ

data.price: and with gardens and springs.
data.arabic: وَجَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ

data.price: I fear for you the punishment of a momentous day.”
data.arabic: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: They said, “It is the same to us whether you admonish us or not.
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ

data.price: This is nothing but the custom of the former people,
data.arabic: إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا خُلُقُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: and we will never be punished.”
data.arabic: وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

data.price: Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe,
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: The people of Thamūd rejected the messengers
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: when their brother Sālih said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
data.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Will you be left secure in whatever you have here,
data.arabic: أَتُتۡرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَٰهُنَآ ءَامِنِينَ

data.price: in gardens and springs,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٖ

data.price: and in fields of crops and date palms laden with tender fruit,
data.arabic: وَزُرُوعٖ وَنَخۡلٖ طَلۡعُهَا هَضِيمٞ

data.price: carving out houses in the mountains with great skill?
data.arabic: وَتَنۡحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِبَالِ بُيُوتٗا فَٰرِهِينَ

data.price: So fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: And do not obey the command of the transgressors,
data.arabic: وَلَا تُطِيعُوٓاْ أَمۡرَ ٱلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ

data.price: those who spread corruption in the land and never do what is right.”
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ

data.price: They said, “You are but one of those who are bewitched!
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسَحَّرِينَ

data.price: You are but a human like us, so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.”
data.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: Sālih said, “This is a she-camel[18]; she will have her share of water and you will have yours, each on a specified day.
data.arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
data.footnotes: [18] That was miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allah.

data.price: Do not touch her with harm, or you will be seized by the punishment of a horrible day.”
data.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: But they hamstrung her, then they became regretful,
data.arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصۡبَحُواْ نَٰدِمِينَ

data.price: So the punishment seized them[19]. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [19] They were destroyed by a violent earthquake and a blast after Sālih told them: “You have only three days to enjoy yourselves in your houses”. See 11:65. Allah says: “We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs”. See 54:31.

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: The people of Lot rejected the messengers,
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطٍ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
data.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Do you approach males with lust among all people[20],
data.arabic: أَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلذُّكۡرَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [20] i.e., Are there any creatures besides you who commit this abominable act?

data.price: leaving the wives whom your Lord has created for you? You are but a transgressing people.”
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ

data.price: They said, “O Lot, If you do not desist, you will surely be expelled.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ

data.price: Lot said, “I am one of those who utterly abhor your practice.
data.arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡقَالِينَ

data.price: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequences of] what they do.”
data.arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهۡلِي مِمَّا يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: So We saved him and all his family,
data.arabic: فَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥٓ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: except an old woman who was among those who remained behind[21].
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزٗا فِي ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [21] Lot's wife, who betrayed him by not believing and remained a disbeliever; thus, she was among those destroyed.

data.price: Then We destroyed the rest,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: and We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. How terrible was the rain of those who were warned!
data.arabic: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: The people of the Forest[22] rejected the messengers.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَ أَصۡحَٰبُ لۡـَٔيۡكَةِ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
data.footnotes: [22] i.e., the people of Madyan, to whom Shu‘ayb was sent.

data.price: When Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,
data.arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمۡ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٞ

data.price: so fear Allah, and obey me.
data.arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

data.price: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Give full measure and do not be of those who defraud others,
data.arabic: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ

data.price: and weigh with accurate scales,
data.arabic: وَزِنُواْ بِٱلۡقِسۡطَاسِ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقِيمِ

data.price: and do not defraud people of their goods, nor go about in the land spreading corruption.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ

data.price: And fear the One Who created you and the former peoples[23].”
data.arabic: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكُمۡ وَٱلۡجِبِلَّةَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
data.footnotes: [23] i.e., generations of the past.

data.price: They said, “You are truly bewitched!
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسَحَّرِينَ

data.price: You are only a human being like us, and we think you are nothing but a liar.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ

data.price: So cause pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if you are of the truthful.”
data.arabic: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

data.price: Shu‘ayb said, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the punishment of the cloudy day; it was the punishment of a horrible day.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ

data.price: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

data.price: This is indeed a revelation from the Lord of the worlds,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: which the Trustworthy Spirit [Gabriel] has brought down
data.arabic: نَزَلَ بِهِ ٱلرُّوحُ ٱلۡأَمِينُ

data.price: to your heart [O Prophet] so that you may be one of the warners,
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ قَلۡبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُنذِرِينَ

data.price: in a clear Arabic language.
data.arabic: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيّٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: And it was indeed [mentioned] in the scriptures of the former peoples.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَفِي زُبُرِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of the Children of Israel recognized it [to be true][24]?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
data.footnotes: [24] e.g., Abdullah ibn Salām, a Jewish scholar, accepted Islam during the lifetime of the Prophet (ﷺ), for he knew that he came with a true message.

data.price: If We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ نَزَّلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضِ ٱلۡأَعۡجَمِينَ

data.price: and he had recited it to them[25]; still, they would not have believed in it.
data.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [25] As a miracle from Allah.

data.price: This is how We made it [i.e., disbelief] enter the hearts of the wicked.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكۡنَٰهُ فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,
data.arabic: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ

data.price: which will come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.
data.arabic: فَيَأۡتِيَهُم بَغۡتَةٗ وَهُمۡ لَا يَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: They will then say, “Can we be granted some respite?”
data.arabic: فَيَقُولُواْ هَلۡ نَحۡنُ مُنظَرُونَ

data.price: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
data.arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ

data.price: Tell me [O Prophet] if We give them a life of ease for years,
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ إِن مَّتَّعۡنَٰهُمۡ سِنِينَ

data.price: then there came to them what they were warned of,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ جَآءَهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: what would avail them the life of ease that they were given?
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ

data.price: We never destroyed any town without sending them warners,
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

data.price: to admonish them, for We are never unjust.
data.arabic: ذِكۡرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

data.price: This [Qur’an] is not sent down by the devils[26],
data.arabic: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتۡ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
data.footnotes: [26] As the disbelievers claim; rather, it is brought down by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.

data.price: it is not for them to do this, nor is it within their capability,
data.arabic: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِي لَهُمۡ وَمَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ

data.price: for they are strictly barred from overhearing it[27].
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلسَّمۡعِ لَمَعۡزُولُونَ
data.footnotes: [27] So they cannot eavesdrop on heaven. See 72:9.

data.price: So do not call upon any other god besides Allah, lest you become of those who will be punished.
data.arabic: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ

data.price: And warn [starting with] the nearest kinsfolk,
data.arabic: وَأَنذِرۡ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلۡأَقۡرَبِينَ

data.price: and lower your wing [in kindness] to the believers who follow you.
data.arabic: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: But if they disobey you, say, “I disown what you do.”
data.arabic: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
data.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلۡ عَلَى ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ

data.price: Who sees you when you stand up [for prayer],
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَرَىٰكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

data.price: and your movements among those who prostrate.
data.arabic: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ

data.price: Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ

data.price: Shall I inform you upon who the devils descend?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

data.price: They descend upon every sinful liar,
data.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٖ

data.price: who whisper hearsay in the ears, but most of them are liars.
data.arabic: يُلۡقُونَ ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَأَكۡثَرُهُمۡ كَٰذِبُونَ

data.price: As for poets, they are followed by the deviants.
data.arabic: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡغَاوُۥنَ

data.price: Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley[28],
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
data.footnotes: [28] Telling lies indiscriminately, praising some, and disparaging others.

data.price: and that they say what they do not do?
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمۡ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much and defend themselves[29] after being wronged. The wrongdoers will come to know what end awaits them.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [29] By replying to the satire of hostile poets through poetry.

data.price: Tā Sīn[1]. These are the verses of the Qur’an and a clear book;
data.arabic: طسٓۚ تِلۡكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ وَكِتَابٖ مُّبِينٍ
data.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

data.price: a guidance and glad tidings for the believers,
data.arabic: هُدٗى وَبُشۡرَىٰ لِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: those who establish prayer and give zakah, and who firmly believe in the Hereafter.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤۡتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ هُمۡ يُوقِنُونَ

data.price: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds appealing to them, so they wander blindly.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمۡ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ فَهُمۡ يَعۡمَهُونَ

data.price: Such are those who will have a terrible punishment, and it is they who will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمۡ سُوٓءُ ٱلۡعَذَابِ وَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلۡأَخۡسَرُونَ

data.price: Indeed, you are receiving the Qur’an from the All-Wise, All-Knowing.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ مِن لَّدُنۡ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ

data.price: [Remember] when Moses said to his family, “I have spotted a fire. I will bring you some news[2] from there, or bring you a burning brand so that you may warm yourselves.”
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهۡلِهِۦٓ إِنِّيٓ ءَانَسۡتُ نَارٗا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنۡهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوۡ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٖ قَبَسٖ لَّعَلَّكُمۡ تَصۡطَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [2] For they lost their way in the dark while traveling from Midian to Egypt.

data.price: When he came to it, he was called, “Blessed is He Who is at the fire and those who are around it[3]. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِيَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِي ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنۡ حَوۡلَهَا وَسُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., the angels around the fire.

data.price: O Moses, verily this is Me – Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
data.arabic: يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ

data.price: Throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering as if it were a snake, he turned and ran away without looking back. “O Moses, do not be afraid! Indeed, the messengers should have no fear in My presence,
data.arabic: وَأَلۡقِ عَصَاكَۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهۡتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنّٞ وَلَّىٰ مُدۡبِرٗا وَلَمۡ يُعَقِّبۡۚ يَٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفۡ إِنِّي لَا يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: except he who does wrong, then substitutes good for evil, then I am indeed All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسۡنَۢا بَعۡدَ سُوٓءٖ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٞ

data.price: Put your hand into your garment, it will come out shining white without blemish, as one of nine signs to Pharaoh and his people[4], for they are indeed a rebellious people.”
data.arabic: وَأَدۡخِلۡ يَدَكَ فِي جَيۡبِكَ تَخۡرُجۡ بَيۡضَآءَ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ سُوٓءٖۖ فِي تِسۡعِ ءَايَٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَقَوۡمِهِۦٓۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [4] See footnote 23:45.

data.price: But when Our visible signs came to them, they said, “This is clear magic.”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتۡهُمۡ ءَايَٰتُنَا مُبۡصِرَةٗ قَالُواْ هَٰذَا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: They denied them wrongfully and arrogantly, although their hearts were convinced that they were true. See then how was the end of those who spread corruption!
data.arabic: وَجَحَدُواْ بِهَا وَٱسۡتَيۡقَنَتۡهَآ أَنفُسُهُمۡ ظُلۡمٗا وَعُلُوّٗاۚ فَٱنظُرۡ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ

data.price: We gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, “All praise be to Allah, Who has favored us[5] over many of His believing slaves.”
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيۡمَٰنَ عِلۡمٗاۖ وَقَالَا ٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٖ مِّنۡ عِبَادِهِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [5] They were privileged by prophethood, the ability to communicate with animals and birds, control the wind, use the jinn for their service, etc.

data.price: Solomon succeeded David, and said, “O people, we have been taught the speech of birds, and we have been given from all things. This is indeed a clear favor.”
data.arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيۡمَٰنُ دَاوُۥدَۖ وَقَالَ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمۡنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيۡرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلۡفَضۡلُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

data.price: Solomon’s armies of jinn, men and birds were assembled before him, marching in organized ranks,
data.arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيۡمَٰنَ جُنُودُهُۥ مِنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ وَٱلطَّيۡرِ فَهُمۡ يُوزَعُونَ

data.price: until when they reached a valley of ants, an ant said, “O ants, get into your dwellings, so Solomon and his armies do not crush you unknowingly.”
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَوۡاْ عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمۡلِ قَالَتۡ نَمۡلَةٞ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمۡلُ ٱدۡخُلُواْ مَسَٰكِنَكُمۡ لَا يَحۡطِمَنَّكُمۡ سُلَيۡمَٰنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ وَهُمۡ لَا يَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: So he smiled in amusement at its words and said, “My Lord, inspire me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and my parents, and to do righteous deeds that please you. And admit me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous slaves.”
data.arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكٗا مِّن قَوۡلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوۡزِعۡنِيٓ أَنۡ أَشۡكُرَ نِعۡمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِيٓ أَنۡعَمۡتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَيَّ وَأَنۡ أَعۡمَلَ صَٰلِحٗا تَرۡضَىٰهُ وَأَدۡخِلۡنِي بِرَحۡمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: Once he checked the birds, and said, “Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe – or is he among the absent?
data.arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيۡرَ فَقَالَ مَالِيَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلۡهُدۡهُدَ أَمۡ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡغَآئِبِينَ

data.price: I will surely punish him severely, or slaughter him, unless he brings me a valid reason.”
data.arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُۥ عَذَابٗا شَدِيدًا أَوۡ لَأَاْذۡبَحَنَّهُۥٓ أَوۡ لَيَأۡتِيَنِّي بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: It was not long before the hoopoe came and said, “I have learned something that you do not know; I come to you from Sheba with sure news.
data.arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيۡرَ بَعِيدٖ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمۡ تُحِطۡ بِهِۦ وَجِئۡتُكَ مِن سَبَإِۭ بِنَبَإٖ يَقِينٍ

data.price: I found a woman[6] ruling over them, who has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.
data.arabic: إِنِّي وَجَدتُّ ٱمۡرَأَةٗ تَمۡلِكُهُمۡ وَأُوتِيَتۡ مِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ وَلَهَا عَرۡشٌ عَظِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [6] Known as Bilqīs, the Queen of Sheba.

data.price: I found her and her people prostrating before the sun instead of Allah. Satan has made their deeds appealing to them and turned them away from the right way, so they are not guided.
data.arabic: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوۡمَهَا يَسۡجُدُونَ لِلشَّمۡسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ فَصَدَّهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمۡ لَا يَهۡتَدُونَ

data.price: so that they do not prostrate before Allah Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth, and Who knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal.
data.arabic: أَلَّاۤ يَسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِي يُخۡرِجُ ٱلۡخَبۡءَ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَيَعۡلَمُ مَا تُخۡفُونَ وَمَا تُعۡلِنُونَ

data.price: Allah; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.”
data.arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ۩

data.price: Solomon said, “We will see whether you have told the truth or you are one of the liars.
data.arabic: ۞ قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقۡتَ أَمۡ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ

data.price: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then withdraw and see how they respond.”
data.arabic: ٱذۡهَب بِّكِتَٰبِي هَٰذَا فَأَلۡقِهۡ إِلَيۡهِمۡ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا يَرۡجِعُونَ

data.price: The Queen said, “O chiefs, a noble letter has been delivered to me.
data.arabic: قَالَتۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمَلَؤُاْ إِنِّيٓ أُلۡقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَٰبٞ كَرِيمٌ

data.price: It is from Solomon, and it reads, ‘In the name of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِن سُلَيۡمَٰنَ وَإِنَّهُۥ بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ

data.price: Do not be arrogant towards me, but come to me in full submission.”
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَعۡلُواْ عَلَيَّ وَأۡتُونِي مُسۡلِمِينَ

data.price: She said, “O chiefs, advise me in this matter of mine, for I would make no decision without your consent[7].”
data.arabic: قَالَتۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمَلَؤُاْ أَفۡتُونِي فِيٓ أَمۡرِي مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمۡرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشۡهَدُونِ
data.footnotes: [7] Or without your presence to hear from you.

data.price: They said, “We are powerful and great fighters, but the decision is yours, so consider what you will command.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ نَحۡنُ أُوْلُواْ قُوَّةٖ وَأُوْلُواْ بَأۡسٖ شَدِيدٖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ إِلَيۡكِ فَٱنظُرِي مَاذَا تَأۡمُرِينَ

data.price: She said, “When kings enter a town, they ravage it and humiliate its notables; this is what they really do.
data.arabic: قَالَتۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُواْ قَرۡيَةً أَفۡسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوٓاْ أَعِزَّةَ أَهۡلِهَآ أَذِلَّةٗۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: But I will send them a gift, then see with what response the envoys will return[8].”
data.arabic: وَإِنِّي مُرۡسِلَةٌ إِلَيۡهِم بِهَدِيَّةٖ فَنَاظِرَةُۢ بِمَ يَرۡجِعُ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [8] She wanted to see whether Solomon was a true prophet or only a king who would be satisfied with a tribute.

data.price: When the envoy came to Solomon, he said, “Do you seek to appease me with wealth? What Allah has given me is far better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who take pleasure in gifts.
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيۡمَٰنَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٖ فَمَآ ءَاتَىٰنِۦَ ٱللَّهُ خَيۡرٞ مِّمَّآ ءَاتَىٰكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمۡ تَفۡرَحُونَ

data.price: Go back to them; we will surely come to them with forces that they cannot resist, and we will surely drive them out therefrom in disgrace, fully humbled[9].”
data.arabic: ٱرۡجِعۡ إِلَيۡهِمۡ فَلَنَأۡتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٖ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخۡرِجَنَّهُم مِّنۡهَآ أَذِلَّةٗ وَهُمۡ صَٰغِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] In case they refused to submit.

data.price: He said, “O chiefs, which one of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?”
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمَلَؤُاْ أَيُّكُمۡ يَأۡتِينِي بِعَرۡشِهَا قَبۡلَ أَن يَأۡتُونِي مُسۡلِمِينَ

data.price: A powerful jinn said, “I will bring it to you before you rise up from your council, and I am strong enough and trustworthy.”
data.arabic: قَالَ عِفۡرِيتٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبۡلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَۖ وَإِنِّي عَلَيۡهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمِينٞ

data.price: But the one who had some knowledge of the scripture[10] said, “I will bring it to you in the blink of your eye.” When he saw it placed before him, he said, “This is a favor of my Lord, to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. Whoever is grateful, it is only for his own good; and whoever is ungrateful, then my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Most Generous.”
data.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِي عِندَهُۥ عِلۡمٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبۡلَ أَن يَرۡتَدَّ إِلَيۡكَ طَرۡفُكَۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسۡتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَٰذَا مِن فَضۡلِ رَبِّي لِيَبۡلُوَنِيٓ ءَأَشۡكُرُ أَمۡ أَكۡفُرُۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشۡكُرُ لِنَفۡسِهِۦۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّي غَنِيّٞ كَرِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., A man of righteousness and knowledge of the scripture who also knew Allah's Magnificent Name (Al-’Ism Al-‘Azam), by Which if supplication was made would be answered.

data.price: He said, “Disguise her throne for her, so we may see whether she can discover the truth, or she will be of those who cannot recognize.”
data.arabic: قَالَ نَكِّرُواْ لَهَا عَرۡشَهَا نَنظُرۡ أَتَهۡتَدِيٓ أَمۡ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَهۡتَدُونَ

data.price: So when she came, she was asked, “Is your throne like this?” She said, “It looks as if it is the same. We were given knowledge beforehand[11], and have submitted [to Allah].”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتۡ قِيلَ أَهَٰكَذَا عَرۡشُكِۖ قَالَتۡ كَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَۚ وَأُوتِينَا ٱلۡعِلۡمَ مِن قَبۡلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسۡلِمِينَ
data.footnotes: [11] Because he had refused our tribute sent to him, or we had known about his kingdom and authority before seeing this sign of bringing the throne from this long distance. Or "We were given knowledge beforehand" was Prophet Solomon’s statement, which means: We were given knowledge beforehand that she will come submitting to Allah, and we were submissive and obedient to Allah Almighty.

data.price: But she was hindered [from the faith] because she used to worship other than Allah, for she came from a disbelieving people.
data.arabic: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعۡبُدُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتۡ مِن قَوۡمٖ كَٰفِرِينَ

data.price: It was said to her, “Enter the palace.” But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water[13], so she uncovered her calves. He said, “This is a palace paved with crystal.” She said, “My Lord, I have wronged myself, and now I submit along with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.”
data.arabic: قِيلَ لَهَا ٱدۡخُلِي ٱلصَّرۡحَۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتۡهُ حَسِبَتۡهُ لُجَّةٗ وَكَشَفَتۡ عَن سَاقَيۡهَاۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ صَرۡحٞ مُّمَرَّدٞ مِّن قَوَارِيرَۗ قَالَتۡ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمۡتُ نَفۡسِي وَأَسۡلَمۡتُ مَعَ سُلَيۡمَٰنَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] The floor of the palace was transparent, under which was flowing water.

data.price: We sent to the people of Thamūd their brother Sālih [saying], “Worship Allah,” then they suddenly split into two quarreling factions[14].
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمۡ صَٰلِحًا أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمۡ فَرِيقَانِ يَخۡتَصِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] i.e., believers and non-believers.

data.price: He said, “O my people, why do you seek to hasten punishment rather than good?[15] If only you sought Allah’s forgiveness, so that you may be shown mercy!”
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ لِمَ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبۡلَ ٱلۡحَسَنَةِۖ لَوۡلَا تَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُرۡحَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [15] They challenged Sālih to bring them the punishment rather than asking for mercy from Allah.

data.price: They said, “We consider you and those who are with you as a bad omen.” He said, “Your omen is from Allah, but you are a people who are being tested.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ ٱطَّيَّرۡنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَۚ قَالَ طَٰٓئِرُكُمۡ عِندَ ٱللَّهِۖ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٞ تُفۡتَنُونَ

data.price: There were nine men in the city who used to spread corruption in the land without doing anything good.
data.arabic: وَكَانَ فِي ٱلۡمَدِينَةِ تِسۡعَةُ رَهۡطٖ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ

data.price: They said, “Let us all swear by Allah that we will kill him and his family by night. Then we will tell his heir[16], ‘We did not witness the murder of his family, and we are indeed truthful.’”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ تَقَاسَمُواْ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُۥ وَأَهۡلَهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِۦ مَا شَهِدۡنَا مَهۡلِكَ أَهۡلِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَصَٰدِقُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., the one who executes his will and avenges his blood.

data.price: Thus they made a plan and We too made a plan, but they were unaware of it.
data.arabic: وَمَكَرُواْ مَكۡرٗا وَمَكَرۡنَا مَكۡرٗا وَهُمۡ لَا يَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: See then what was the consequences of their plan: We destroyed them and their entire people.
data.arabic: فَٱنظُرۡ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ مَكۡرِهِمۡ أَنَّا دَمَّرۡنَٰهُمۡ وَقَوۡمَهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: Now their houses are utterly ruined because of their wrongdoing. Indeed, there are signs in this for people of knowledge.
data.arabic: فَتِلۡكَ بُيُوتُهُمۡ خَاوِيَةَۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓاْۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لِّقَوۡمٖ يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: And We saved those who believed and feared Allah.
data.arabic: وَأَنجَيۡنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَكَانُواْ يَتَّقُونَ

data.price: And [remember] Lot, when he said to his people, “Do you commit this shameful act[17] while seeing [one another][18]?
data.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذۡ قَالَ لِقَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلۡفَٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمۡ تُبۡصِرُونَ
data.footnotes:
[17] i.e., sodomy.
 [18] i.e., publicly, or while you are aware [that it is wrong].

data.price: Do you approach men with lust instead of women? In fact, you are an ignorant people!”
data.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمۡ لَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهۡوَةٗ مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٞ تَجۡهَلُونَ

juz.name: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ
juz.transEn: And Those Who Do Not Expect
